War crimes in Ukraine: Police close investigation into murders in a street in Bucha
subhead: Ukrainian police have issued wanted notices for six Russian soldiers over the premeditated murder of 17 civilians in Bucha, a suburb of Kyiv, in 2022. In total, 378 bodies were found in the city.

40 million Americans face food stamp disruption amid shutdown
subhead: Today, around one in eight Americans receives Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits each month based on income, according to the Department of Agriculture. In the event of non-payment, states have invited recipients to make use of food banks, which could be swiftly overwhelmed by the demand.

title: French lawmakers vote against wealth tax on super-rich
subhead: The proposal would impose a 2% tax on wealth over €100 million, which garnered a lot of popular support. It was proposed by economist Gabriel Zucman as a tool to help France balance its books.

title: Beware of food poisoning from Halloween pumpkins
subhead: Every year, dozens of people in France suffer mainly digestive symptoms after eating inedible squash. The biochemical origins of this plant toxicity are now better understood.

title: The French cities utterly transformed by Airbnb
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (3/6). Turning an apartment into short-term tourist accommodation may seem harmless. But on a large scale, it ends up transforming entire cities and daily life for their residents. France's politicians are trying to crack down on the system.

Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

title: Three exhibitions in Paris celebrate 100 years of Art Deco
subhead: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

title: 'We're buying time, but we won't win the fight': Senegal's Saint-Louis faces the inexorable rise of the sea
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (3/6). Senegal's historic city will be largely underwater by the end of the 21st century. Several thousand fishermen have already left their homes on the beach for a stifling dormitory town.
